Nope. Riot are officially endorsing, as they always have, that trolls will not be tolerated.

You pick a role, people expect you to play that role, regardless of the champ you are playing at the time. After all, it's what you called/queued for.

META = Most Efficient Tactics Available.

Selecting Support role but then deciding to play Singed the majority of early game as a roaming counter jungle is **not** META is any way. Especially to the ADC you are supposed to be supporting.

If you decide to call a role and then not play it, to the detriment of your teammates, then you also better be prepared to suffer the consequences of your actions. 

After all, your team suffered because of you.

>
> Yes, that is exactly what I am saying. If you queue for a particular role, then the very least you can do is *play that role* to at least the minimum of expectations *of the role.*
> 
> There is nothing "Most Efficient Tactics Available" about a jungler that sits top all lanephase making it a 2v1 lane while they take farm and exp off the Top Laner.  Or an ADC who leaves their Support 1v2 defending botlane and spends more time taking botside jungle off their own jungler and only coming to lane when creeps are under tower. Or a Top who sits in mid or a Mid who takes all the Junglers topside farm *or a Support who roams enemy jungle and leaves their ADC vulnerable and support-less in a 1v2 situation*. 
> 
> That is why no one plays the game that way. It is literally **not the META**.
> 
> Each one of those scenarios has some degree of a detrimental effect on the game overall and leaves *at least one other player* on your team at a disadvantage great enough that it can impact and effect the entire outcome of the game. 
> 
> I cannot stress that enough. If you still want to argue the point and can't understand what I am saying then I am at a loss and really can't be bothered explaining further because it is obviously futile.
> 
> Definition of the word 'Support' as a noun:
> 1. the act or an instance of supporting;
> 2. the state of being supported;
> 3. something that serves as a foundation, prop, brace, or stay;
> 4. maintenance, as of a person or family, with necessaries, means, or funds;
> 5. a person or thing that supports, as financially;
> 6. a person or thing that gives aid or assistance;
> 7. an actor, actress, or group performing with a lead performer.
> 
> By the very definition of the word this person, playing a roaming counter-jungling Support Singed, with no vision item other than a trinket, is *not playing as a support* in the context of the game, and in the expectations of his team *in the role that he has self-selected*.
> 
> Argue against it however you want, but this player has regularly failed to live up to and fulfill, very obviously and deliberately through their choices made in-game, and to even the most basic of requirements, the expectations of their team in *the role they have chosen* so often that the weight of the reports has led to them being banned. You would have to be completely narcissistic to not expect that outcome.
> 
> It matters little what role they is playing or even what champ they choose; they have simply pissed too many people off by, and by definition alone, *being deliberately and with full awareness of the expectations and requirements of that particular role,* the opposite of a supporting player and team mate; they are, quite literally, an anti-support as there is nothing supportive at all in their actions. 
> 
> This is why we have a META. 
> 
> It doesn't matter if you are an ADC, Jungler, Mid, Top or Support... your team are counting on you to perform that particular role within the team. If you regularly and consistently fail to live up to those expectations you will be penalised. Whether it be in losing LP, being reported, losing friends, getting time bans or ultimately being banned entirely from the game, you will very deservedly reap what you sow.

Riot isn't enforcing the META, they're enforcing team play and communication.

Learn the difference before you come onto the boards complaining.

I've never had an issue playing off-META, even in ranked. Why? Because I *clearly and effectively* communicate what I'm doing to the rest of my team, and if the majority of them ask me not to play a particular champion in a particular position I wont do it.

I swear every single time I try to play my main zilean in support in ranked, there is always one 'annoying fellow' like you on my team who threatens to report me for not picking a meta support or the support they wanted. I can clearly explain why I want to play zilean support, I can explain i have a m7 zilean, I can explain that he's by far my best champion all I want, but there is always some 'annoying fellow' who threatens to report me or go afk.

Heck I've even had people threaten to report me for zilean support in normals. People don't like offmeta picks at all but that's their choice, not my issue, who i pick is my prerogative and so long as I play the basics of the role properly (ie vision, support items, trading in lane, peeling, reviving my brain dead adc), that's my choice and if you decide to use all 3 bans on my support hovers, I'm even more likely to pick something even more stupid.

Tbh most of the time I tend to try to pick the best support for the teamcomp because I can play a range of supports, like alistair if we have a yasou and need a tank or zilean if we have a a few hard carry diver champions or if they have a kindred (wait till everyone falls to really low hp and then stun every enemy in the circle just as they come out of invulnerability and maybe revive someone), but this is my choice and it's my responsibility.

It's clearly stated that "While playing Singed Support isn't inherently bannable, refusing to work with your teammates is." and that's what this whole situation comes down to. It doesn't matter what you play, if you're completely disregarding communication and team play then you're engaging in acts that are against the rules and therefore bannable. You could play whatever the hell you wanted to as a support, that's not the issue. The issue is that the person who was banned was doing so *despite their teammates clearly communicating that they didn't want to participate in such an "off-META" experience and that person refused to change their tactics*.

And fun fact, if you report people who refuse to communicate with their teammates (such as your example of "Chinese players who don't use English") then they *will* get punished. Don't try to make excuses for one thing by giving unrelated examples and accept that this *isn't* an issue of "Support Singed" but rather of "refusing to communicate and participate in team play".

To the best of my knowledge, a language barrier is not a punishable offense. Ideally these players would be using pings to communicate in some form, but unless they are actively disrupting the game (like it appears this singed 'support' was by abandoning his adc and running around the jungle) it usually falls under tactical disagreement.
Reminds me of the time that guy got banned for using 'Random' in Ranked, despite it being a feature.

There is almost certainly much more to this story, it doesn't sound like he was banned for playing singed support (even without sightstone).

It's worth remembering we don't have the whole story to this. There's obviously been a miscommunication somewhere along the line, and playing Singed support is not ban worthy. However, consistently refusing to communicate with the team (that doesn't fall under the "tactical disagreement" umbrella) is punishable if done often enough, so it could be something like that.

There is more to this story, I highly doubt he would get banned for playing singed support alone, even if he wasn't buying sightstone (bm as it is). 

We haven't seen his gameplay, We don't even have a summoner name to see his history. We don't know if the 2 million mastery point claim or the >50% winrate claim or the "legitimately trying to win" claim is true without a name/history to look at. The ticket said "found to be affecting a lot of players negatively", and unconventional pick or no, very few people are going to complain about a win.

We don't have anywhere close to the full story, and it would be naive to assume everything in the reddit post was true, or that the ticket outlined the specific behaviour that got him banned (since A. that wasn't what he asked in his ticket, and B. from the ticket response it sounds like he should know what he did wrong, and the support guy is simply answering his questions).

From the sound of the ticket, it also seems like "refusing to communicate with team" might have involved straight up abandoning his ADC and wandering around the enemy jungle, but again, we don't have the full story. With the limited info we have, this could be spun both ways, and unless more info is released we have no proof it was an unjustified ban. Ultimately this is a matter between the singed in question and player support.

An interesting comparison we can make is with the machine learning aspect of the report system. We as the community decide what words and phrases we think are unacceptable (by reporting them) and over time the system determines which are the most ban worthy. 

Although that system was unlikely in play, since it was a manual ban, the premise still holds - we as the community, or at least _enough_ of us, decided playing off-role wasn't acceptable (by reporting them) and _that_ was what led to the outcome. 

If the were never reported we would have never even know they existed.
